meanings.definition: To bring into harmony or agreement
meanings.sent1: She tried to attune her guitar strings to the correct pitch.
meanings.sent2: It is important to attune your actions with your values.
meanings.sent3: The birds seemed to attune their chirping to the rhythm of the music playing.
meanings.sent4: His heart and mind were attuned, like a well-tuned instrument.
meanings.sent5: The dancers moved in perfect attunement with the music, creating a mesmerizing performance.

meanings.sent1: He needed to attune himself to the subtle changes in the environment.
meanings.sent2: Parents should attune to their children's emotional needs.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to attune his senses to pick up on the faintest clues.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was attuned to the energies around her, guiding her decisions.
meanings.sent5: The artist's eyes were attuned to the beauty in the smallest details, inspiring her work.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a particular situation or environment
meanings.sent1: The new employee needed time to attune to the company's culture.
meanings.sent2: It's essential to attune your speech to the audience you are addressing.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon had to attune its colors to blend in with the surroundings.
meanings.sent4: She had to attune her schedule to accommodate the unexpected changes.
meanings.sent5: The plant slowly attuned to the sunlight, growing stronger and healthier each day.
